Business.name: Cap corporation tax at the current level of 25% for the next parliament
Create the Regulatory Innovation Office to update regulation and speed up approval timelines
Regulate AI tech companies to ensure safe development and use of AI models
Ban the creation of sexually explicit deepfakes

Crime.name: Ensure swift compensation for sub-postmasters affected by the Horizon IT scandal

Economy.name: Every fiscal event making significant changes to taxation or spending will be subject to an independent OBR forecast
Move the budget into balance, so that day-to-day costs are met by revenues
Debt must be falling as a share of the economy by the fifth year of the forecast
Increase tax registration and reporting requirements to tackle tax avoidance
End the use of offshore trusts to avoid inheritance tax
Increase the rate of stamp duty paid by non-UK residents

Education.name: Free breakfast clubs in every primary school
Access to training, an apprenticeship, or support to find work for all 18-to-21-year-olds
Two weeks' worth of work experience for every young person

Employment.name: Reform or replace Work Capability Assessment
Worker protections for unfair dismissal, parental leave and sick pay from day one of employment
Remove minimum wage age bands, putting everyone on the highest minimum wage

Environment.name: Invest £1 billion to accelerate the deployment of carbon capture
Invest £500 million to support the manufacturing of green hydrogen
Accelerate the rollout of electric vehicle charge points
Restore the phase-out date of 2030 for new cars with internal combustion engines
Standardise the information supplied on the condition of batteries to support buyers of second-hand electric cars
Double onshore wind, triple solar power, and quadruple offshore wind by 2030
Extend the lifetime of existing nuclear power plants and build new ones
Maintain a strategic reserve of gas power stations to guarantee security of supply
Maintain oil and gas production in the North Sea, neither issuing new licenses or revoking existing ones

Housing.name: Create 1.5 million new homes over the next parliament
Introduce a permanent, comprehensive mortgage guarantee scheme for first-time buyers
Give first-time buyers the first chance to buy homes
Ban housing developments being pre-sold to international investors

Immigration.name: Create a new Border Security Command with hundreds of officers
Hire additional caseworkers to clear the backlog of asylum seekers
Set up a new 1000-person Returns and Enforcement unit to fast-track removals to safe countries for illegal immigrants
Increase the number of safe countries that failed asylum seekers can swiftly be sent back to

Infrastructure.name: Invest £1.8 billion to upgrade ports and build supply chains across the UK
Invest £1.5 billion to new gigafactories for the automative industry
Invest £2.5 billion to rebuild our steel industry
Invest £1.5 billion to new gigafactories for the automative industry
Improve rail connectivity across the north of England
Full gigabit and national 5G coverage by 2030
Fix one million potholes across England in each year of the next parliament
Lift the ban on councils / local authorities setting up their own bus companies

National Security.name: Apply a new 'NATO test' to major defence programmes to ensure the UK's NATO commitments are fulfilled in full
Implement Martyn's Law, requiring large venues to take additional steps to mitigate the impact of a terrorist attack

Political Reform.name: Appoint a Covid Corruption Commissioner to recoup public money lost in pandemic-related fraud and from contracts which have not delivered
End the link between access to ministers and an inside track for public contracts
